intro: Codonochlamys glaziovii, commonly known as the Glaziov's codonorchis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its unique, intricate floral structure. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color, with a distinctive hood-like shape. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
